statements: To increase public trust in institutions, we should pair stronger transparency and accountability with reliable, high-quality service delivery that people can see and measure. Those who worry about corruption or abuse deserve clearer oversight, open data, and consequences for wrongdoing, while those who fear politicized attacks on institutions deserve protections for independence, due process, and professional standards. Building trust will require regular two-way engagement with communities, fair and consistent enforcement of rules, and performance metrics that are audited and easy to understand.
